item.title: 摩根大通因交易报告不充分将支付近 3.5 亿美元罚金
item.description: 美国联邦储备委员会（Federal Reserve）周四宣布，摩根大通银行（JPMorgan Chase & Co）被两家美国银行监管机构罚款 3.482 亿美元，原因是其监控公司和客户交易活动是否存在市场不当行为的计划不充分。【原文：JPMorgan Chase & Co has been fined $348.2 million by a pair of U.S. bank regulators over its inadequate program to monitor firm and client trading activities for market misconduct, the Federal Reserve announced Thursday.】

item.title: 资产管理公司称美股结算加速对欧洲构成 "系统性风险
item.description: 欧洲资产管理行业周四表示，华尔街将完成股票交易的时间缩短一半的举措将给欧洲带来 "系统性风险"，除非市场参与者有更多的时间来排队购买股票。【原文：Wall Street's move to halve the time it takes to complete a stock trade will create a "systemic risk" in Europe unless market participants get more time to line up dollars for stock purchases, Europe's asset management industry said on Thursday.】

item.title: 美国 1 月份商业库存保持不变
item.description: 由于零售商库存的增加被制造商和批发商库存的减少所抵消，1 月份美国商业库存出人意料地保持不变。【原文：U.S. business inventories were unexpectedly unchanged in January as increases in stocks at retailers were offset by declines at manufacturers and wholesalers.】

item.title: Zara 所有者 Inditex 因专注于数字化而削减中国门店
item.description: Zara 的所有者 Inditex 去年在中国的税前利润增长了一倍多，尽管这家时装零售商缩减了实体店的规模，关闭了其在中国五分之一的门店，这表明其对网络销售的重视正在取得成效。【原文：Zara-owner Inditex more than doubled its pre-tax profits in China last year even as the fashion retailer scaled back its physical presence, closing a fifth of its stores in the country in a sign its focus on online sales is bearing fruit.】

item.title: 受红海危机影响，Zara 所有者 Inditex 宣布延迟一周开业
item.description: 全球最大的服装零售商 Inditex 表示，由于红海危机，运载其产品的集装箱船避开苏伊士运河，绕道非洲南端，平均航运时间推迟了约一周。【原文：The world's biggest apparel retailer Inditex said average shipping times have been delayed by about a week by the Red Sea crisis, as container ships carrying its products avoid the Suez Canal and travel around the southern tip of Africa.】

item.title: 阿克豪斯与梅西百货就尽职调查进行谈判，以争取更高的出价
item.description: 梅西百货的投资者 Arkhouse Management 公司周四表示，该公司正在与投资公司商谈，以便对更高报价的前景进行尽职调查。【原文：Macy's investor Arkhouse Management said on Thursday the U.S. department store was in talks with the investment firm for opening its books for due diligence on the prospects of a higher offer.】

item.title: 纽约市广播公司在错过截止日期后向美国证券交易委员会提交年度报告
item.description: 纽约社区银行周四向美国证券交易委员会提交了年度报告，在错过监管机构规定的最后期限一个多星期后提交。【原文：New York Community Bancorp filed its annual report with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission on Thursday, more than a week after missing the regulator's mandated deadline.】

item.title: 2024 年德国家用太阳能电池销售额将增长 26
item.description: 行业协会 BVES 周四表示，随着越来越多的家庭选择更便宜的可再生能源供应，用于在家中储存太阳能电力的电池今年在德国的销量可能会激增 26%。【原文：Sales of batteries to store solar electricity at home could jump by 26% in Germany this year as more households opt for cheaper and renewable energy supplies, industry association BVES said on Thursday.】

item.title: 汽油和食品推动 2 月份美国生产者价格上涨
item.description: 在汽油和食品等商品成本激增的情况下，美国 2 月份生产者价格涨幅超过预期，这可能会引发人们对通胀回升的担忧。【原文：U.S. producer prices increased more than expected in February amid a surge in the cost of goods like gasoline and food, which could fan fears that inflation was picking up again.】

item.title: 拜登表示美国钢铁公司必须继续由国内所有和经营
item.description: 美国总统乔-拜登（Joe Biden）将于周四发表声明，反对美国钢铁公司（U.S. Steel Corp）以 149 亿美元收购日本新日铁公司（Nippon Steel）。【原文：U.S. Steel Corp , the $14.9 billion acquisition target of Japan's Nippon Steel , must remain a domestically owned and operated American firm, President Joe Biden will say in a statement on Thursday opposing the proposed merger.】

item.title: 希尔顿将收购 Graduate Hotels，这是自 1999 年以来的首次品牌收购
item.description: 希尔顿周四表示，将以 2.1 亿美元的价格从 Adventurous Journeys Capital Partners 手中收购 Graduate Hotels，这是该公司二十多年来首次收购品牌，因为酒店业的压力为整合创造了机会。【原文：Hilton said on Thursday it will buy Graduate Hotels from Adventurous Journeys Capital Partners for $210 million, marking its first brand acquisition in over two decades as pressure in the hotel industry creates opportunity for consolidations.】

item.title: 欧盟就可能存在非法在线产品的问题对阿里速卖通进行调查
item.description: 阿里巴巴旗下的阿里速卖通可能面临巨额罚款，因为欧盟委员会周四对阿里速卖通传播潜在的非法和色情材料展开调查，这是继社交媒体平台 X 和 TikTok 之后的第三次此类调查。【原文：Alibaba's AliExpress could face a hefty fine after the European Commission on Thursday opened an investigation into dissemination of potentially illegal and pornographic materials, the third such probe after social media platform X and TikTok.】

item.title: 意大利埃尼公司在最新战略中增加投资者回报
item.description: 意大利能源集团埃尼公司（Eni）表示，由于预计在2024-27年期间将从资产组合管理中获得80亿欧元（87.4亿美元）的净收益，该公司将把分配政策提高到其运营现金流（CFFO）的30%至35%。【原文：Italian energy group Eni said it would increase its distribution policy to between 30% and 35% of its cash flow from operations (CFFO) as it expects 8 billion euros ($8.74 billion)in net proceeds from asset portfolio management in the 2024-27 period.】

item.title: 微策略公司在 10 天内发行第二笔可转债，以购买更多比特币
item.description: 微策略公司（MicroStrategy）将通过发行可转换债券筹集资金购买更多比特币，这是该公司在不到10天的时间内第二次发行可转换债券，因为这家积极的加密货币投资者希望增加其在全球最大加密货币领域的投资。【原文：MicroStrategy will raise capital to buy more bitcoin through convertible bonds offering for the second time in less than 10 days, as the aggressive crypto investor looks to increase its exposure into the world's largest cryptocurrency.】

item.title: 经济数据公布后，交易员坚持押注美联储 6 月降息
item.description: 周四公布的生产者价格强于预期，而消费者支出弱于预期，这几乎没有动摇金融市场对美联储将于6月开始降息的押注，其依据是与美国中央银行政策利率挂钩的期货合约价格。【原文：Stronger than expected producer prices and weaker-than-expected consumer spending reported Thursday did little to budge financial market bets on a June start to Federal Reserve interest-rate cuts, based on prices of futures contracts that settle to the U.S. central bank's policy rate.】

item.title: 意大利依维柯集团扩大合作关系，预计到 2028 年收入将增长 20
item.description: 意大利客车和卡车制造商依维柯集团（Iveco Group）周四表示，预计到2028年收入将增长20%，同时公布了一项新的业务计划，重点是扩大产品组合和工业合作伙伴关系。【原文：Italian bus and truck maker Iveco Group said on Thursday it forecast revenue growth of 20% by 2028 as it unveiled a new business plan focused on an expanding product portfolio and industrial partnerships.】

item.title: 美国 2 月零售销售反弹；每周申请失业救济人数下降
item.description: 受汽车经销商和加油站销售增长的推动，美国 2 月份零售额出现反弹，但由于家庭正在努力应对通胀和借贷成本上升，消费支出正在放缓。【原文：U.S. retail sales rebounded in February, driven by increases at auto dealerships and gasoline service stations, but consumer spending is slowing as households grapple with inflation and higher borrowing costs.】

item.title: 据 CNBC 报道，前财政部长姆努钦召集投资者收购 TikTok
item.description: 美国前财政部长史蒂文-姆努钦（Steven Mnuchin）周四告诉 CNBC，他正在组建一个投资者小组，试图收购 TikTok。【原文：Former U.S. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin is putting together an investor group to try to buy TikTok, he told CNBC on Thursday.】

item.title: 宝马第四季度汽车业务利润率超预期，但股息下降
item.description: 受中国合资企业华晨宝马汽车公司（BBA）全面并表和销量增长的影响，宝马汽车公司周四公布其核心汽车业务的利润率有所上升。【原文：BMW reported a higher margin in its core automotive segment on Thursday, driven by full consolidation of its Chinese joint venture BMW Brilliance Automotive (BBA) and better sales volumes.】

item.title: 欧洲监管机构称批准中国喷气机需要时间
item.description: 欧洲航空安全监管机构的高级官员告诉路透社记者，该机构将不惜一切代价批准中国的C919客机，这打击了中国政府迅速打入以飞机短缺和波音安全危机为标志的市场的希望。【原文：Europe's air safety regulator will take whatever time is needed to approve China's C919 passenger jet, its top official told Reuters, dampening Beijing's hopes of quickly breaking into a market marked by jet shortages and a Boeing safety crisis.】

item.title: 研究发现：外国企业在德国的投资降至十年来最低点
item.description: IW 研究所周四的一项研究显示，去年外国企业在德国的投资创下了十年来的最低水平，欧洲最大的经济体正面临着去工业化的担忧。【原文：Investment in Germany by foreign firms was at its lowest level in a decade last year, an IW institute study showed on Thursday, as de-industrialisation fears loomed over Europe's largest economy.】

item.title: 新加坡航空公司准备发行 10 年期美元债券，条款表显示
item.description: 根据路透社周四看到的一份条款表，新加坡航空公司（SIA）以美国国债加110个基点的利率发行了5亿美元的10年期美元债券。【原文：Singapore Airlines or SIA has launched a $500 million 10-year dollar bond at U.S Treasuries plus 110 basis points, according to a term sheet seen by Reuters on Thursday.】

item.title: 通胀数据和零售销售数据公布前期货上涨
item.description: 由于投资者在美联储下周会议之前等待包括生产者价格数据在内的一系列经济数据，追踪华尔街主要股指的期货周四走高。【原文：Futures tracking Wall Street's main stock indexes advanced on Thursday as investors awaited a raft of economic data, including the producer prices numbers, ahead of the Federal Reserve's meeting next week.】

item.title: 思科 280 亿美元收购 Splunk 获得欧盟反垄断许可
item.description: 周三，思科系统公司以 280 亿美元收购网络安全公司 Splunk 的交易获得了欧盟无条件反垄断批准，因为欧盟监管机构表示，他们没有发现任何竞争问题。【原文：Cisco Systems won unconditional EU antitrust approval for its $28 billion bid for cybersecurity firm Splunk on Wednesday after EU regulators said they did not see any competition issues.】

item.title: 汉堡王母公司 Restaurant Brands 任命内部人士 Sami Siddiqui 担任首席财务官
item.description: 餐厅品牌国际公司（Restaurant Brands International）周四任命萨米-西迪基（Sami Siddiqui）为首席财务官，并对其他领导层进行了一系列调整，以推进公司的长期目标，应对部分国际市场的疲软。【原文：Restaurant Brands International on Thursday named Sami Siddiqui as its chief financial officer and made a slew of other leadership changes, as the company pushes ahead with its long-term goals and navigates weakness in some international markets.】

item.title: NatWest 银行破产后，英国提议制定 "去银行化 "法律
item.description: 英国前脱欧党魁奈杰尔-法拉奇（Nigel Farage）去年曾表示，他因政治原因被 "去职"，此后，英国周四提出了一项法律草案，要求银行在关闭客户账户前必须提前三个月通知客户并做出解释。【原文：Britain proposed a draft law on Thursday that will compel banks to give customers three months' notice and an explanation before closing their accounts, after former Brexit Party leader Nigel Farage said last year he was 'debanked' on political grounds.】

item.title: 由于成本紧缩，Dollar General 预计 2024 年利润低于预期
item.description: 周四，Dollar General 与竞争对手 Dollar Tree 一样，预计年度利润低于华尔街预期，这表明成本上升以及顾客消费转向低利润消费品对其利润率造成了影响。【原文：Dollar General joined rival Dollar Tree in projecting annual profit below Wall Street estimates on Thursday, in a sign that higher costs as well as a shift in customer spending towards lower-margin consumables weighed on its margins.】

item.title: 2 月份托管资产强劲增长，Robinhood 跳涨
item.description: Robinhood Markets 周四在盘前交易中股价攀升近 13%，此前该经纪公司报告 2 月份托管资产强劲增长，表明加密货币和股票交易的回暖将继续推动该公司的发展。【原文：Robinhood Markets shares climbed nearly 13% in premarket trading on Thursday after the brokerage reported strong growth in assets under custody for the month of February, signaling continued boost from a comeback in cryptocurrency and stock trading.】

item.title: 气候适应投资者路线图为应对全球变暖指明方向
item.description: 几个关注气候问题的组织在周四的一份报告中说，更快、更猛烈的野火和其他自然灾害正在激发投资者的兴趣，让他们把赌注押在如何适应不可避免的气候变化上。【原文：Faster and more furious wildfires and other natural disasters are sparking investors' interest in betting on how to adapt to inevitable changes to the climate, several climate-focused groups said in a report on Thursday.】

item.title: 英伟达下周让开发者一睹新人工智能芯片的风采
item.description: Nvidia 及其首席执行官黄仁勋（Jensen Huang）作为科技界人工智能芯片的主导供应商，还能撑多久？【原文：How long can Nvidia and its CEO, Jensen Huang, wear the crown as the tech world's dominant supplier of artificial-intelligence chips?】
